title: Citizens' Assembly Protocol
author: CivHub
summary: A randomly selected group of citizens is convened to deliberate on a policy issue and produce recommendations based on structured discussion and expert input.
use_cases: Local planning or land use issues

steps.label: Topic Selection
steps.description: An issue of public concern is selected by policymakers or petitioned by the public.

steps.label: Participant Selection
steps.description: A statistically representative group of residents is selected using random sampling.

steps.label: Deliberation Period
steps.description: Participants meet over several sessions, guided by facilitators and informed by expert presentations.

steps.label: Recommendation Drafting
steps.description: Participants produce a public report with recommendations or proposed actions.
